page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY OF MELKSHAM
page.content: In 1816 while digging for coal on the outskirts of Melksham, a mineral water spring was discovered. They gave up coal mining and started Melksham Spa Company. A well was sunk and a pump room with cubicles for baths built. People who came to bathe stayed in 6 large semi-detatched sp houses. Unfortunately few people came to Melksham ans Bath was more popular and the spa closed in 1822. The spa houses are still used. They are 4 storeys high and have tiled fireplaces in some rooms. Third floor rooms have wrought iron balconies. The original porches are also wrought iron. Higher in the house rooms get less fancy. There are plaster decorations on the landings and room ceilings. The pump room is now a semi detatched bungalow but the 14 metre deep well is still there.
